alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued May 27 at 4:10AM ChST until May 28 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM CHST SUNDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 9 to 11 feet expected along west facing reefs and up to 9 feet along exposed south and north facing reefs. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 6 PM ChST Sunday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large west swells will decline slightly SUnday and Monday but expected continued westerly swell through much of the week.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
